'Young Jacob Boozer, III' (born November 23, 1948), is an American
banker and the current state treasurer in Alabama. Boozer defeated Democrat
Charles Grimsley for the seat vacated by Kay Ivey, who was unable to run again
for the office due to term limits. In the Republican primary, Boozer beat George
Wallace, Jr. by 30 points. {{Cite news
  | last = first = coauthors = title = Boozer, Grimsley win nominations in
  | treasurer race newspaper = The Birmingham News location = pages = language =
  | publisher = date = 6-02-10 url =
  | http://blog.al.com/spotnews/2010/06/boozer_tops_wallace_in_gop_tre.html
  | accessdate = 9-28-10}} Born in Birmingham, and raised in Tuscaloosa,
  | where he graduated from Tuscaloosa High School. He has lived in Montgomery
  | for the last 25 years. Boozer received a BA in Economics from Stanford
  | University in 1971, and an MBA from the Wharton School of Business in 1973.
  | He is an Eagle Scout, and recipient of the Distinguished Eagle Scout
  | Award.
{{cite web
  | last = first = authorlink = coauthors = title = Young Boozer for Alabama
  | Treasurer - Biography work = publisher = The Committee to Elect Young Boozer
  | date = url = http://www.youngboozerfortreasurer.com/bio.htm doi = accessdate
  | = 10-16-10}}
